qas.question: When did Broca publish his pioneering work?
Who published a work in 1937 on the relationship between emotion and the limbic system?
Along with the cingulate cortex and hippocampi, what structure is a notable part of the limbic system?
When did Broca publish his non-pioneering work?
Who published a work in 1937 on the relationship between non-emotional and the limbic system?
Along with the cingulate cortex and hippocampi, what structure is not a notable part of the limbic system?

context: Emotions are thought to be related to certain activities in brain areas that direct our attention, motivate our behavior, and determine the significance of what is going on around us. Pioneering work by Broca (<a0_0><b3_0>1878<b3_0/><a0_0/>), <a1_0><b4_0>Papez<b4_0/><a1_0/> (1937), and MacLean (1952) suggested that emotion is related to a group of structures in the center of the brain called the limbic system, which includes the <a2_0><b5_0>hypothalamus<b5_0/><a2_0/>, cingulate cortex, hippocampi, and other structures. More recent research has shown that some of these limbic structures are not as directly related to emotion as others are while some non-limbic structures have been found to be of greater emotional relevance.
